instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Can Q7010 be bypassed without any negative effects?
threads.message: Have a macbook air 820-00165 with intermittent power issues. pin 2 of q7010 getting power. tried replacing q7010 and same result. Is there any negative effects of making a solder blob of pin 2 and 4?

threads.title: Can Q7010 be bypassed without any negative effects?
threads.message:
If you bypass Q7010, board will never start with original charger.
Can you post some measurments?

threads.title: Can Q7010 be bypassed without any negative effects?
threads.message: Ok. what measurements would you need?

threads.title: Can Q7010 be bypassed without any negative effects?
threads.message: Any voltage you can get around Q7010 and U7100.

threads.title: Can Q7010 be bypassed without any negative effects?
threads.message:
q7010
pin 2 -0.02 mV
pin 4 18.86v
pin 5  19.1v
pin 6  19.1v

U7100 
pin 2 0.02mV

threads.title: Can Q7010 be bypassed without any negative effects?
